intro: Bellidiaster montanus, commonly known as the mountain bellidiaster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the summer. Bellidiaster montanus is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions.
